page.title: 18RELIGION IN BILSTHORPE
page.content: The spiritual needs of the residents are mostly met by 4 denominations, Church of England, Catholic, Methodist and Pentecostal. The Parish Church St. Margarets is the oldest denomination. Its building is used by Church of England members and Roman Catholic worshippers. A special dispensation was given by the Bishop of Southwell so that the Catholics could hold a weekly service. The Methodist Chapel in Valley Road is used for Sunday Morning worship and Sunday School plus evening prayer. It has a midweek Youth Club for 2 age groups and a Mums and Toddlers Fellowship. The Pentecostal Church is the newest group, run under the auspices of the Assemblies of God. They meet in a wooden hall in Mickledale Lane, which belonged to St. Margaret. Their congregation is small but growing.
